column2: text
You are the Immortals. You are without pain. You are without fear. You are without death.
Immortals led by Rykarth the Unbreakable on his quest to obtain for the Nemesis Crown.
The Taur'ruks lead entire battalions of Bull Centaurs into battle. They throw themselves in combat with a wild frenzy for blood.
The Ba'hal are the temple guardians. Hulking, savage creatures of terrible strength.
Lord Gargath of Baal was granted an entire regiment of Bull Centaurs by Lord Ghorth himself; a rare honour indeed.
Warped and malign creatures, Chaos Dwarf Bull Centaurs are, as the name suggests, twisted amalgams of Chaos Dwarfs and ferocious bulls.
Physically, Chaos Dwarfs resemble other Dwarfs. Their souls, though, have been warped beyond recognition making them cruel, self-centered beings.
This renowned band of Chaos Dwarf Warriors are part of Astragoth Ironhand's forces, but may join an army led by another Overlord if needed.
The Chaos Dwarf regiments armed with Blunderbusses are called Devastators.
One of the terrors that dwell in the crags and craters of ash and fire is the Great Taurus. Less a beast and more a manifestation of the savagery of the Darklands themselves.
Hobgoblins favour the bow as it allows them to attack their enemies from a distance.
The vilest and most treacherous of the Greenskin kin, Hobgoblins are taller and leaner than ordinary Goblins, yet nowhere near as burly and brutal as Orcs.
Sneaky Gits fight in battle with two long curving knives, ideally suited to their backstabbing methods.
Some Chaos Dwarf armies employ wolf-mounted Hobgoblin Raiders as scouts and light cavalry in battle.
These are Chaos Dwarfs with dishonour or failure attached. Their names and kinships are shorn away and their faces are seared and shut underneath red-hot iron masks.
The most elite fighting units of religious fanatics among the Dawi Zharr.
Naptha bombs are made of sorcerous concoctions of sulphurous chemicals filtered through the essence of fire-daemons.
The Berzerkers work themselves into a frenzy before going into battle with the use of potent drugs mixed with blood.
Only the greatest Sorcerer-Prophets are able to forge these monsters of metal and flame.
The priests of Hashut have managed to create a race of beings, the K'daai. These are half Daemons and half raging fire drawn from the magma of the depths of the earth.
It is believed that the Lammasu is a rare mutation of the Great Taurus, twisted by the powers of Chaos into a huge bull-shaped monster cloaked in smoke and shadow.
Orcs and Goblins are common slaves in the Chaos Dwarf realms. They are native to the Darklands and are hardy creatures who will often last longer in the treacherous pits.
The Deathshrieker is one of the most diabolical Chaos Dwarf weapons, for it releases bound up and howling fire spirits upon the enemy.
Dreadquake Mortars are amongst the largest and most effective of all the Chaos Dwarfs mighty siege arsenal.
Hobgoblins use these to launch long, sharp sticks at their enemies.
One of the latest designs to see widespread service within the Chaos Dwarf empire is the Iron Daemon, a compact, armoured steam-driven traction engine.
A fiendish weapon, originally used to clear out the ravening hordes of trolls and other monsters in the Dark Lands.
Ogres make good slaves for the Pits, and if needed they can be sent to the battlefield for brute force.
A rare breed of trolls that have been seen only in the Dark Lands.
A Chaos Dwarf Sorcerer named Korakagrakk created his "Magma Beasts" to attack Talabheim.
Powered by arcane machinery, the Kollossus is a giant construct used extensively in sieges.
The personal bodyguard of the covenant of Sorcerer-Prophets that make up the ruling echelon of the Legion of Azgorh.
The Lord of the Black Fortress is both a mighty sorcerer and an able warrior in battle.
The legendary Captain of the Immortals, Rykarth is viewed as a paragon of Chaos Dwarfen toughness, resolve and cunning.
Some say that Zhatan is the most heartless and cruel Chaos Dwarf ever born, and he lives up to his reputation.
It is said that in the veins of such aristocratic Chaos Dwarfs flows the very blood of the dark god Hashut himself.
The sinister Daemonsmiths forge their instruments of war through arcane rituals and evil sorcery, binding the very essence of Chaos into their armaments.
The High Priests of the Dawi Zharr have embraced the art of sorcery through their foul devotion to the worship of Chaos and pacts made with ancient, despicable Daemons.
The captains of the Infernal Guard of Azgorh are known to be cruel and to drill their troops ceaselessly.
Occasionally the spiteful infighting within the ranks of the Hobgoblins will give birth to a successful and feared killer who will rise to prominence and be known as Khan.
The bigger and nastier Bull Centaurs lead the stampede into battle.
Mercenaries from the Mountains of Mourn. Their thirst for battle has led them to join the Chaos Dwarf hosts.
Only a few Khans grow strong enough to lead an army of Hobgoblins; even less those that manage to command Chaos Dwarf warriors as well.
